intro: Cryptantha calycosa, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and small, alternate leaves. Cryptantha calycosa is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
